main event: On March 3, 1953, at Luke AFB, Arizona, a high altitude condensation pattern was observed, which was determined to be linked to a rapidly moving unidentified object.
interesting points: The observation lasted for approximately 20 minutes,The object exhibited an estimated speed of 400 mph,The pilots described the contrail as irregular and that it stayed with the unlighted object rather than extending across the sky,The object was never visually identified, but was accompanied by a vapor trail,No aircraft were reported in the area during the time of sighting.
sighted object: high altitude condensation pattern linked to a possibly unidentified object
witness description: Pilots from a squadron conducting training missions at Luke AFB
